poem:
### The Dance of Time

In the quiet hours,  
while the world breathes its unseen rhythm,  
clocks retrace their steps—  
an autumn waltz of lost seconds  
and regained shadows.  
The hands inch backwards,  
mocking our understanding.  
Yet, in the silent mechanics of ages,  
we obey, nurturing a trust  
in this ritual of old light.
